page.title: 14MEMORIES OF RAWTHORPE 2
page.content: Mrs.Leng remembered there was a{ {'knocker-up'}who came around early each morning and banged on people's bedroom windows with a long stick.He did not go away until a light went on.He was paid a small fee by people requiring his services and his nick-name was{"bumps"}The{gas-lamps} were lit each night by a{lamp-lighter} and put out again each morning.Everyone looked forward to their annual holiday,if they went away at all they visited{ {Morecambe,Blackpool or Scarborough}by train or coach. After living in the area for so long,Mrs.Wright 56 years and Mrs.Leng 36 years,both ladies said that things were very different in 1985.However,neither of them would choose to move away as{Rawthorpe Lane {was their home. }
